Class Raytracer.Ray

  • java.lang.Object
    • Raytracer.Ray
  • Enclosing class:
    Raytracer

    class Raytracer.Ray
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a ray that can be traced. After tracing, the hit data is stored in the same Ray object, so the shading at that point can be computed next if desired.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ray

        Ray​(Raytracer.Vector3 origin,
    Raytracer.Vector3 direction)
        Create a Ray given the origin point and direction vector.
        Parameters:
        origin - the origin point of the ray (point when t=0).
        direction - unit vector defining the direction of the ray.

      • Ray

        Ray​(Raytracer.Vector3 origin,
    Raytracer.Vector3 direction,
    float maxDistance)
        Create a Ray given the origin point and direction vector.
        Parameters:
        origin - the origin point of the ray (point when t=0).
        direction - unit vector defining the direction of the ray.
        maxDistance - (optional) any hits beyond this distance will be ignored. Also known as the far clipping plane.

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString​()
        Generates a human-friendly String representation of this Ray for debugging purposes.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • getPoint

        public Raytracer.Vector3 getPoint​(float t)
        Evaluates the equation of the line at t. Since direction is a unit vector, this will return the point t units away from the ray's origin, in the direction of the direction vector.
        Parameters:
        t - the distance from the ray's origin.
        Returns:
        a point t units away from the ray's origin, in the direction of the direction vector.

      • trace

        public boolean trace​(Raytracer.Scene scene)
        Determines the closest SceneObject that this ray intersects with. The t value (distance to the camera), the SceneObject that was hit, and the hit point are stored in this Ray object, for later use in getPointShading().
        Parameters:
        scene - the Scene containing the SceneObjects to test for intersection.
        Returns:
        whether or not any object was hit.

      • getPointShading

        public Raytracer.Vector3 getPointShading​(Raytracer.Scene scene)
        Determines the color of the point that was hit by this ray.
        Parameters:
        scene - the Scene containing the relevant data.
        Returns:
        vector representing the RGB color of the point.
